intro: Pedicularis lutescens var. tongtchuanensis, commonly known as the Tongtchuan yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and is often found growing in rocky or alpine habitats. It has a short, hairy stem with opposite leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and flies. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
